Articles.Content:
Would that be the J-2X configuration? It thought that would be how it would look with RL-10 engines, and then there'd be another, larger upper stage for the Block II. Where did I go wrong?

You're not wrong, it's just confusion because of the shotgun style approach of nasaspaceflight with regard to what renderings they show.

Above is the J2-X config, the RL-10's would be about half the engine size. The Boeing Large Upper Stage is SLS core stage diameter just like I show here, however there are a variety of ~5 meter interim stages being tossed around in the graphics so it gets confusing. Yes, the Block II upper will be larger still, but not in terms of maximum diameter, it will have a taller tank up top (maybe twice) and look a lot more like the Block II Chaka Large Upper Stage from a few pages ago.

Sorry for the confusion, indeed showing four J2-X engines on this smaller upper stage is very strange except that 1) I'm testing both of those parts right now and 2) This config may be useful for MTV orbital assembly to give an extra delta kick right after 2nd stage sep.

Oh look, a picture!

Just imagine there are little RL-10's hanging from the Talus. Hmmm that sounds odd.

With regard to which for what...

You're gonna want the one on the right with some RL-10's for a smaller payload that goes somewhere far. The one on the left is for a larger payload that also goes far. The mixed config I made up top would be for a larger payload that is only going to orbit. LOL in other words the exact opposite of the payload I pictured with it.

Edited June 7, 2014 by YANFRET

You're not wrong, it's just confusion because of the shotgun style approach of nasaspaceflight with regard to what renderings they show.

Just imagine there are little RL-10's hanging from the Talus. Hmmm that sounds odd.

With regard to which for what...

You're gonna want the one on the right with some RL-10's for a smaller payload that goes somewhere far. The one on the left is for a larger payload that also goes far. The mixed config I made up top would be for a larger payload that is only going to orbit. LOL in other words the exact opposite of the payload I pictured with it.

I've been kind of using this mod as a modern extension of my FASA-style game so this is pretty neat!

So... the SLS Block I/IB/IA/CanIjustgiveupnow will use a smaller-than-core diameter upper stage, powered by four RL-10s. The upper stage of the Block II will look the same as the other one, but larger and powered by... two J-2X's? Anyway, if you're looking for an RL-10, you can always ask Frizzank. He has made quite a nice one just a few days ago.

So... the SLS Block I/IB/IA/CanIjustgiveupnow will use a smaller-than-core diameter upper stage, powered by four RL-10s. The upper stage of the Block II will look the same as the other one, but larger and powered by... two J-2X's? Anyway, if you're looking for an RL-10, you can always ask Frizzank. He has made quite a nice one just a few days ago.

Strictly speaking the Interim Cryogenic Propulsion Stage for SLS block I/IB/IA etc would have one RL-10, beginning with the Delta IV upper and changing it as they need to. Oh yes, I mentioned up top Frizzank (awesome) did offer to license his new RL-10 and I am very interested in it as well.
Alright, so ICPS (which would only be flown once) is just the DCSS, EUS is the same but with more RL-10s, and then the upper stage for Block II would use the J-2X's?

Alright, so ICPS (which would only be flown once) is just the DCSS, EUS is the same but with more RL-10s, and then the upper stage for Block II would use the J-2X's?

Except that the "EUS" or "DUUS" or "LUS" - whichever you want to call it, is 8.4 meters on the top tank where as the ICPS/DCSS is 5 meters on the upper tank. The full scale Block II upper stage is also 8.4 meters but is taller and would use J-2X in two or three engine config. (depending on the destination; three for MTV construction, two for TMI)

EDIT: Sorry mis typed.... ICPS/DCSS is four meters not five in SLS block I baseline ^

Edited June 9, 2014 by YANFRET

For some reason the game is crashing every time I try to add the square docking port to a hab module. Error log gives "(0x000000014043C91C) (KSP): (filename not available): NxCreateCoreSDK + 0xd390c" message. I think maybe I'm missing a plugin but I'm not sure. Anybody run into this before?

For some reason the game is crashing every time I try to add the square docking port to a hab module. Error log gives "(0x000000014043C91C) (KSP): (filename not available): NxCreateCoreSDK + 0xd390c" message. I think maybe I'm missing a plugin but I'm not sure. Anybody run into this before?

Yeah that's a new one on me. Try a clean install and go from there?

Edited June 10, 2014 by YANFRET

Except that the "EUS" or "DUUS" or "LUS" - whichever you want to call it, is 8.4 meters on the top tank where as the ICPS/DCSS is 5 meters on the upper tank. The full scale Block II upper stage is also 8.4 meters but is taller and would use J-2X in two or three engine config. (depending on the destination; three for MTV construction, two for TMI)

Ahhhh... so there's the DCSS/ICPS, then EUS (which looks like the ICPS, but with core stage diameter and powered by a lot of RL-10's) and then there's the larger Block II upper stage which I don't know how will look, but is powered by J-2X's.

Anyway, that Type FX looks really neat.

Ahhhh... so there's the DCSS/ICPS, then EUS (which looks like the ICPS, but with core stage diameter and powered by a lot of RL-10's) and then there's the larger Block II upper stage which I don't know how will look, but is powered by J-2X's.

Anyway, that Type FX looks really neat.

Just to add a little more confusion, I mis spoke above. The DCSS/ICPS is 4 meters in SLS config, although there is also a 5 meter version. For Block I the 4 meter DCSS would sit inside a fairing, but a 5 meter version would mount common with the Orion SM fairing. Then, beyond that would be the 8.4 meter products.

By the way, for Monkey Orion systems above, wait for it, I'm using a 5 meter (at 75% scale) config with a J-2X, not the SLS Block I ICPS or 4 meter DCSS. Think of it as a common ground between the Aries I upper and a Delta IV core stage with SRB's added.

Edited June 9, 2014 by YANFRET

First ever view of Orion heat shield with reflective tape:

Maybe we should check out that reflection plugin!

Does anyone know if the issue of blue reflections at night was ever resolved?
We are watching

We are watching

Chaka is always watching

MTV Update:

Okay so what we have here, other than the new textures, is a single propulsive stage where the structural docking rings are used in place of the drop tank truss. SO the upper tank is released before MOI burn, and a replacement tank (pre positioned at "DUNA" orbit) is inserted into the stack before TEI burn.

Edited June 12, 2014 by YANFRET

I have to say that.......this is one of the best put together mods ever!! I love that you took the best of the most popular mods and totally made them your own and packaged them this way. I have had so much fun fooling around with this it nuts. I thought there were going to be more craft files based on the pictures you've posted through out this thread, but thats not a complaint I have had a lot of fun just throwing stuff together. That all being said I did encounter a few issues. The engine on the orion seems to work but doesn't have any effects coming out the nozzle. Also based on some of the picture especially on the last page it seems that I might have an outdated download possibly, unless the stuff you post is WIP, then my bad. Finally seperatrons are a much needed addition, if you plan on updates that is something you need to consider adding especially on the big SRBS. Anyway keep up the great work this is awesome.

Also I had a problem with the parachutes. The chutes seems to open out of order.

Edited June 12, 2014 by sp1989

First ever view of Orion heat shield with reflective tape:

http://www.nasa.gov/sites/default/files/dsc_0389.jpg

Maybe we should check out that reflection plugin!

Does anyone know if the issue of blue reflections at night was ever resolved?

The blue reflection problem is not fixed yet. It still plagues FASA I always remove it.
[obligatory lame joke about MTV and lack of music videos]

I have to say that.......this is one of the best put together mods ever!! I love that you took the best of the most popular mods and totally made them your own and packaged them this way. I have had so much fun fooling around with this it nuts. I thought there were going to be more craft files based on the pictures you've posted through out this thread, but thats not a complaint I have had a lot of fun just throwing stuff together. That all being said I did encounter a few issues. The engine on the orion seems to work but doesn't have any effects coming out the nozzle. Also based on some of the picture especially on the last page it seems that I might have an outdated download possibly, unless the stuff you post is WIP, then my bad. Finally seperatrons are a much needed addition, if you plan on updates that is something you need to consider adding especially on the big SRBS. Anyway keep up the great work this is awesome.

Also I had a problem with the parachutes. The chutes seems to open out of order.

Thanks!

Yep, that update is getting rather old and you're right about all of those issues. I decided the next download should be a few more steps forward or a rough draft of a beta so it's taking some time. It is a bit of a tease to keep showing you guys new stuff and then you go find the same out of date download, I get that. But your feedback on the new product images helps guide me as well.

The blue reflection problem is not fixed yet. It still plagues FASA I always remove it.

* CLEARS DESK * .... ...thank you for the status update

I mean I am very excited about the upcoming updates but I am having a lot of fun with the current state of the pack. Quick question why not use the rpm IVA that bobcat made for the orion? Is that a licensing thing?

I mean I am very excited about the upcoming updates but I am having a lot of fun with the current state of the pack. Quick question why not use the rpm IVA that bobcat made for the orion? Is that a licensing thing?

Yay politically correct answers tyme! Not a licensing thing. Also, Talisar Aerospace has a contract with CMES to produce a bespoke IVA at 1.12 scale so that, among other things, the windows match up. Since we were compelled to drop a pile of work on the accounts receivable desk at Talisar Aerospace last week, status on that IVA is TBD.

Active Thermal Control

Kosmos TM Radiator system built into MTV tank to prevent boil off

Edited June 13, 2014 by YANFRET
Just looking through the zip... Is there any reason to keep the multiple copies of things that I seem to already have? Such as the cupola or all the KW stuff...

Just looking through the zip... Is there any reason to keep the multiple copies of things that I seem to already have? Such as the cupola or all the KW stuff...

Edit:

Generally if something is in the zip file it's there for a reason, however with each alpha version I am reducing the surplus parts clutter and cleaning up un needed texture files as the mission requirements become more well understood.
